subject: Learning
title: Neural Pruning: Use It or Lose It
description: A quick win: understand Neural Pruning: Use It or Lose It.

hook.text: A newborn has twice as many neural connections as an adult. By age three, half of them are gone.

buildup.text: The brain starts with a massive overproduction of synapses, then prunes unused connections to become efficient.

discovery.text: Connections that fire frequently are strengthened. Unused connections are eliminated. Experience sculpts the brain.

twist.text: This means early experience literally shapes brain architectureâ€”not just knowledge, but the hardware of thought.

climax.text: Enriched environments with varied stimulation produce denser, more connected neural networks in children.

punchline.text: The brain builds from experience. What a child does shapes what it becomes.

quiz.question: What is neural pruning?
options: The elimination of unused neural connections to make the brain more efficient
The growth of new neurons throughout childhood
A surgical procedure to improve brain function
